page.title: 08Ecology
page.content: The block is rich in{flora and {fauna. }The soils tend to be reddish and of a slightly sandy nature. Generally{winters}can be said to be mild and damp. When extreme conditions are experienced this block can be totally{cut off by snow.} Summers are warm and moist. Many of the established{elm trees were attacked by{Dutch Elm disease}and died. The landscape changed quite considerably as trees were felled. Ash, elms, hawthorns, alders, willows, hazel, holly and oaks are still seen in the hedgerows. {Country lanes}have high banks on either side and these are covered in a variety of wild flowers and grasses.In a mile stretch from Stogumber Village to Kingswood 20 different wild flowers were recorded in April.
